body: Have also started seeing this as of today. Downgrading to 7.54.0 fixed it in the interim. Was previously on `^7.49.2` which auto increments minor versions to latest (compatible).
We encountered the same issue after upgrading from 7.51.4 to 7.54.4. Reverting to the previous working version resolved the problem.
I am using a monorepo and downgrading to 7.54.2 is not fixing it.

@vineethvijayan314 Is there any chance that you're getting upgraded to 7.55 inadvertently? (For example, the latest @hookform/resolvers depends on 7.55.) It may be worth checking your monorepo tooling, package lockfiles, and `node_modules` tree to verify that 7.54.2 is actually installed and that 7.55 isn't creeping in somehow.

I believe the issue has to do with a change in `watch` since both in the provided codesandbox repro and in my case removing usage of `watch` prevents the issue (maybe [this PR](https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/pull/12537/files) which is in v7.55.0 ? or maybe [this one](https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/pull/12564/files))

I'm experiencing the same issue here and downgrading to 7.54.2 works - with 7.55.0 sometimes the app fully crashes the tab instead of showing maximum call stack size exceeded. Bummer since @hookform/resolvers ^5 has a peer dependency of ^7.55.0

Even with the dependency warning all is well - in some places I have to pass the generic to `useForm` (which I don't need with @hookform/resolvers v5 - but the app runs)

> Bummer since @hookform/resolvers ^5 has a peer dependency of ^7.55.0
>
> Even with the dependency warning all is well - in some places I have to pass the generic to useForm (which I don't need with @hookform/resolvers v5 - but the app runs)

Yes. As I understand it, the only changes between @hookform/resolvers v4 and v5 are related to TypeScript types. (It made some improvements to type inference that depend in RHF ^7.55.0's types.) Runtime behavior is unchanged, so, as long as people are willing to deal with any compile-time TypeScript issues, @hookform/resolvers 5.0.1 will work just fine with RHF 7.54.

issue.title: issue: setValue triggers Maximum Call Stack error

repository.name: react-hook-form
repository.description: ðŸ“‹ React Hooks for form state management and validation (Web + React Native)

issue.body:
### Version Number

7.55.0

### Codesandbox/Expo snack

https://codesandbox.io/p/sandbox/tctl4v?file=%2Fsrc%2FApp.tsx

### Steps to reproduce

1. Run the included codesandbox
2. The page hangs, and results in Maximum Call Stack error after a few seconds.
3. This happens when I call `setValue` to update the value of the form.

#### Reason
The error happens when I include MooTools (it is included in the `<script...` tag in the `index.html`. If I remove Mootools, it works fine.

#### Diagnosis
MooTools modifies the `Object.prototype` which includes a self reference to `$family` object. `setValue` is using `for...in` loop which goes over the `prototype` properties as well, and hence gets stuck in the loop of self-referencing objects.
The issue happened as a part of this commit https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/commit/c03c66eb8d650a9a881fe47d3e968b80ec7b3918#diff-5a85c1643c71f45e050ce584d7c0db2bdf2e56f8a7dae86d74fedf01be2d2cab. 

Earlier `setValue` was using `Object.entries` to go over the `values` properties (which only takes `ownProperties` into account). But with the `for...in` change, it takes prototype properties as well.
https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/blob/a66b52a4f0d5c0de3c09307c074371e3e881ce73/src/logic/createFormControl.ts#L659-L681


### Expected behaviour

The Maximum Call Stack error should not happen.

#### Potential fix
There are two potential fixes:
- Either Change the `for...in` to `Object.keys` in `setValues` to iterate over the `values` object.
```diff
- for (const fieldKey in value) {
+ Object.keys(value).forEach((fieldKey) => {
```
https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/blob/56a1fbcdb062ea4beaed5cfb7535bd7d62a908b8/src/logic/createFormControl.ts#L583-L607
- Or add a `hasOwnProperties` check inside the loop to filter out the prototype properties. 
```diff
+ if (!value.hasOwnProperty(fieldKey) {
+   return;
+ }
```

### What browsers are you seeing the problem on?

Chrome

### Relevant log output

```shell
Uncaught RangeError: Maximum call stack size exceeded
    at get hasIndices (<anonymous>)
    at get flags (<anonymous>)
    at [Symbol.split] (<anonymous>)
    at String.split (<anonymous>)
    at get (index.esm.mjs:142:31)
    at setValues (index.esm.mjs:1255:21)
    at setValues (index.esm.mjs:1256:111)
    at setValues (index.esm.mjs:1256:111)
    at setValues (index.esm.mjs:1256:111)
    at setValues (index.esm.mjs:1256:111)
    at setValues (index.esm.mjs:1256:111)
    at setValues (index.esm.mjs:1256:111)
    at setValues (index.esm.mjs:1256:111)...
```

### Code of Conduct

- [x] I agree to follow this project's Code of Conduct

issue.title: Rollback react-hook-form to 7.54.2

repository.name: squiggle
repository.description: This monorepo covers multiple QURI projects, including Squiggle language, Squiggle Hub and Metaforecast

issue.body:
7.55.0 causes browser freezes on playground settings page and item settings modals.

Upstream issue: https://github.com/react-hook-form/react-hook-form/issues/12714

(be very careful when upgrading to new react-hook-form versions in the future, though this seems critical enough that they'll probably fix it upstream somehow)

body: We saw similar behavior with watch and 7.55.0.  I didn't get the error, but it would infinitely run the watch function and lock up the browser window.   Reverting to 7.54.2.
